title: Create blacklist table
description:
Define the blacklist table for filtering out spam, personal email providers, and transactional senders.

## Schema Definition
```sql
CREATE TABLE blacklist (
  id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
  pattern TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,
  type TEXT NOT NULL CHECK (type IN ('domain', 'email', 'regex')),
  category TEXT NOT NULL CHECK (category IN ('spam', 'personal', 'transactional', 'noreply', 'custom')),
  reason TEXT,
  is_system BOOLEAN DEFAULT 0,
  created_at TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now'))
);
```

## Pattern Types
- domain: Exact domain match (e.g., 'gmail.com')
- email: Exact email match (e.g., 'noreply@example.com')
- regex: Pattern match (e.g., '^no-?reply@')

## Categories
- spam: Known spam domains
- personal: Consumer email providers (gmail, yahoo, etc.)
- transactional: Automated senders (notifications, receipts)
- noreply: No-reply addresses
- custom: User-defined filters

## Indexes
- UNIQUE idx_blacklist_pattern for deduplication
- idx_blacklist_type_category for filtered queries

## Seeding
- Pre-populate with common personal domains
- Include major transactional sender patterns
- System entries marked with is_system=1

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Support multiple pattern types
- [ ] Categories enable selective filtering
- [ ] System entries protected from user deletion
- [ ] Efficient pattern matching queries

title: Create initial migration file
description:
Create the 0001_initial.sql migration file from the schema definition for D1 deployment.

## Migration File
Create: packages/api/migrations/0001_initial.sql

## Requirements
- Copy all CREATE TABLE statements from schema.sql
- Add all CREATE INDEX statements
- Include initial blacklist seed data
- Ensure idempotent execution (IF NOT EXISTS)

## Migration Format
```sql
-- Migration: 0001_initial
-- Created: <timestamp>
-- Description: Initial database schema

-- Enable foreign keys
PRAGMA foreign_keys = ON;

-- Tables (in dependency order)
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS companies (...);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS domains (...);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS contacts (...);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS emails (...);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS blacklist (...);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS sessions (...);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS sync_state (...);
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS processed_messages (...);

-- Indexes
CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS ...;

-- Seed data
INSERT OR IGNORE INTO blacklist (...) VALUES (...);
```

## Wrangler Integration
- File must be in migrations/ directory
- Naming convention: NNNN_description.sql
- Run with: wrangler d1 migrations apply

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All tables created in correct order
- [ ] All indexes created
- [ ] Blacklist seed data included
- [ ] Migration is idempotent (safe to re-run)
- [ ] Tested with local D1 via Miniflare

title: Add delete button to companies page
description:
Add a delete button to each company row on the companies page.

When clicked, the delete action should:
1. Add all domains associated with the company to the blacklist (ban list)
2. Delete all contacts linked to the company

title: Create emails table with stats columns
description:
Define the emails table storing individual email addresses with interaction statistics and recent thread references.

## Schema Definition
```sql
CREATE TABLE emails (
  id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
  email TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,
  contact_id TEXT,
  domain_id TEXT,
  display_name TEXT,
  is_primary BOOLEAN DEFAULT 0,
  emails_sent INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
  emails_received INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
  last_email_sent_at TEXT,
  last_email_received_at TEXT,
  first_interaction_at TEXT,
  recent_threads TEXT,  -- JSON array of thread summaries
  avg_response_time_hours REAL,
  created_at TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
  updated_at TEXT DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
  FOREIGN KEY (contact_id) REFERENCES contacts(id) ON DELETE SET NULL,
  FOREIGN KEY (domain_id) REFERENCES domains(id) ON DELETE SET NULL
);
```

## Recent Threads JSON Structure
```json
[{
  "thread_id": "string",
  "subject": "string",
  "date": "ISO8601",
  "snippet": "string"
}]
```

## Indexes
- UNIQUE idx_emails_email for deduplication
- idx_emails_contact_id for contact lookups
- idx_emails_domain_id for domain aggregation
- idx_emails_last_interaction for activity sorting

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Email address is unique and normalized
- [ ] Recent threads limited to last 5-10 for storage
- [ ] Response time calculated from send/receive pairs
- [ ] Both sent and received stats tracked separately
